text:
Hello and welcome to Cupcake Addiction's Hunger
Games Cupcake Tutorial where I'll be showing

you how to make this gorgeous and really easy
Hunger Games cupcake, absolutely so many requests

from you guys for something Hunger Games,
and I'm a massive fan of the series so here's

what I've made for you
Tools and equipment that we will be using

today:
I've got some sticky tape.
I've got some scissors.
A zip lock bag.

I've got some of our perfectly pipeable buttercream
frosting.

Now I've tinted some of that yellow and some
orange.
I've got my cupcake.

I've got my optional Hunger Games printable
cupcake wrapper and I will leave a link to

the download for that in the description box
below.
I've got a spoon.
Some toothpicks.

And I've got my little arrow ends, so that's
also on the printable, and I will leave a
link to that one in the description box below.
So let's get started.
The first thing that we want to do...

If you are going to be using the optional
Hunger Games little printable cupcake wrapper,
you need to print that out.
So print that out on a...

I've used a 210 gsm, relatively not a thick
cardboard but certainly a little bit thicker
and sturdier than paper.

And you can see there, it's a really good
representation of what the Hunger Games is
all about.

If you're not going to use that, you can just
use a black cupcake wrapper or an orange.

Just try to keep with those sort of black
and orange colors.

Now you want to take your wrapper and it's
going to depend on the size of your cupcake.
So just wrap it around the cupcake.

And what you want to be careful of here when
using these wrappers, any of these wrappers,

is you want to try and have your cupcake at
the top of the little cardboard lining because

your buttercream frosting might seep into
that cardboard if your sort of touch it too
much around the cardboard wrapper.

So you can see there, the bottom of my cupcake,
I'm actually up merely a centimeter, but that's

the size that I want because I want it to
lift my cupcake up.

So taking a little bit of that sticky tape,
I'm just going to pop that cupcake out.
I'm going to position the back.

So when you're positioning the back, you just
want to make sure you got your best side out.

So I'm going to go like that and that's about
the size that I want, and then just sticky
tape it.

So just a really easy printed home cupcake
wrapper there.
And then, pop your cupcake in.

So you can see there that's sitting nice and
high on the top.

And it's actually got a little bit of a gap
around, in between the cupcake and the cardboard
cupcake liner.

So that's just going to stop us from getting
any bleeding or any seeping from that buttercream
frosting.

So what we want to do now is we're going to
prepare our zip lock bag.

To make our flame effect, we're going to open
up that zip lock bag and take your spoon.

Spoon in some yellow frosting kind of on one
side of the bag.
So I just use the bag to push it off.

And you don't have to be too neat here because
we want the 2 colors to blend a little bit.
So what do you say?

2, 3 spoons of that and then we'll move to
the orange.

And on the other side, the downside, spoon
in some of your orange frosting.

You probably kind of see where we're going
here with our little flame effect.
Now I like to...

While that's sitting like that, just kind
of push it in the bag a little bit just to
start combining them.
But you don't want to mix the 2 colors.
You just want to start combining them a little.
And do your zip lock bag.

Squeeze any excess air out of the top of your
zip lock bag.

Now, to make our little ends, we're going
to cut off quite a decent-sized corner.

So taking your scissors, you want to cut right
across so you've got a nice sort of a big

chunky corner taken out because we want those
flames to be quite nice and quite large, I
supposed, or else you'll be piping for ages.

Now out of that corner, you're going to cut
another triangle -- 1 and 2.

So what you should end up with is something
that looks like this.

So you can see there, you've got your 1 triangle
across, and then you've got your little cut
in triangle.
Alright, so you've got your bag ready.

And do make sure that you get any of your
little pieces of plastic and just move them

away from your work space because you don't
want those going into the cupcake.
Now we can prepare our little arrow head.

And these are as simple as just sticky-taping
that little bit of card and I've printed that

out at the same time as I've printed my printable
cupcake wrapper.

Stick it on to that cocktail stick or that
toothpick and we're just going to sticky tape
it on.

So you'll see there I've got a little bit
of excess around that little top sections
so we'll just cup that off.
And there you've got your little arrow.

Now bear in mind these are not edible so if
you're going to sell these or if you're giving

them away, you do need to inform your guests
that they're not actually edible and they

need to remove them before they start eating
their cupcake.

If you did want them to be edible, you could
use rice paper to print out those images and

then you could use a noodle, an uncooked spaghetti
noodle.

It will be edible but it's still not going
to taste that great so this will do the job
nicely.

So there you've got your arrows ready to go
and you've got your frosting.

So with the frosting, you always want to give
it a nice squeeze.

See there we've got all of the orange coming
out of the bag so just squeeze it off into

your container until you see both of those
colors coming out.

You can see there as I've squeezed that [on],
you now got 2 colors coming out.

And what you're going to have from making
that little cut in there is a nice ridge.
That's going to give us the real flame effect.

So if you...Look at that frosting, you can
see there it's kind of got 4 little ridges
around it.

So pick your nice side, I'm going to go with
this side.
That side is going to look too orange.

That side, I'm getting a nice combination
of the orange and the yellow.

Take your cupcake and you just want to pipe
almost like sort of blobs or dollops.

It's going to automatically taper off the
top into kind of a bit of a flame-y look or
a pointed tip.

And you can see there, I'm really trying not
to touch it too much to the outside of that
cardboard cupcake wrapper.

Once again, it's just...Because it's cardboard,
it will absorb some of that butter from the

buttercream frosting and it will discolor
it so we don't really want that if possible.
So you just want to work around.

And don't be afraid to turn the bag a little
bit so you're getting a few different effects.
So I've done sort of one layer of it there.
And then we're going to go into another one.
So just fill in some of those gaps.
You can make this as high as you like.

But I kind of like to do a bit of an outer
layer and then a bit of an inner layer.

So I've got a second sort of a circle and
then we'll go into the middle.

We'll do our middle one just a little bit
higher.

If you love this tutorial, make sure that
you head on over to our channel My Cupcake

Addiction and hit the Subscribe button if
you'd like to see more from us.

We've got lots of fabulous tutorials, everything
cupcake, cakepop and cake decorating.

So what you should have now is our Hunger
Games cupcake flames all ready to go.

You want to just simply take your little arrows
and just position them in.

Now you can decide how many arrows you would
like.

Our printable template has enough for 3 arrows
per cupcake.

And I like to do one in quite deep, the middle
one just a little bit higher, and then the
other one off to the side.

And once again, that's completely up to you,
how you would like to position them -- if

you want to have two going in from the same
angle.

So there you have your completed and really
easy Hunger Games cupcake, perfect for your
next Hunger Games-themed event.
And as always, thank you very much for watching.
May the odds be ever in your favor.
